content:
TITLE: Configuring OpenAI API Key in provider.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the OpenAI API key in the provider.json file. It shows how to add the API key to the 'keys' section under 'openai'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
    "keys": {
        "openai": [
            "sk-AAAAAAAAAAAABBBBBBBBBBBBCCCCCCCCCCCCCDDDDDDDDD"
        ]
    }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining LLM Models Configuration in JSON for LangBot
DESCRIPTION: This JSON structure defines the list of supported language models, including their names, requesters, token managers, and supported features. It includes a default model and examples of specific models with different capabilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/metadata/llm-models.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "list": [
        {
            "name": "default",
            "requester": "openai-chat-completions",
            "token_mgr": "openai",
            "tool_call_supported": false,
            "vision_supported": false
        },
        {
            "name": "gpt-3.5-turbo",
            "tool_call_supported": true
        },
        {
            "name": "gpt-4o",
            "tool_call_supported": true,
            "vision_supported": true
        }
    ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Custom Model Metadata in LangBot (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to add metadata for a custom model in the LangBot configuration. It includes settings for the model name, requester type, token manager, and support for tool calls and vision capabilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/workshop/one-api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "name": "qwen",
    "requester": "openai-chat-completions",
    "token_mgr": "openai",
    "tool_call_supported": false,
    "vision_supported": false
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Platform Adapters in platform.json
DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for various message platform adapters including nakuru, aiocqhttp, qq-botpy, qqofficial, and wecom. Each adapter has specific parameters for connection and authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/platform.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"platform-adapters": [
    {
        "adapter": "nakuru",
        "enable": false,
        "host": "127.0.0.1",
        "ws_port": 8080,
        "http_port": 5700,
        "token": ""
    },
    {
        "adapter": "aiocqhttp",
        "enable": false,
        "host": "0.0.0.0",
        "port": 2280,
        "access-token": "",
    },
    {
        "adapter": "qq-botpy",
        "enable": false,
        "appid": "",
        "secret": "",
        "intents": [
            "public_guild_messages",
            "direct_message"
        ]
    },
    {
        "adapter": "qqofficial",
        "enable": false,
        "appid": "",
        "secret": "",
        "port": 2284,
        "token": ""
    },
    {
        "adapter": "wecom",
        "enable": false,
        "host": "0.0.0.0",
        "port": 2290,
        "corpid": "",
        "secret": "",
        "token": "",
        "EncodingAESKey": "",
        "contacts_secret": ""
    },
],
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting OpenAI Model in provider.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting the desired OpenAI model in the provider.json file. It shows how to set the 'model' field.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
    "model": "gpt-4o"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Command Privileges in LangBot
DESCRIPTION: Sets permission levels for different commands in LangBot. Regular users have level 1 access while administrators have level 2. This example shows how to set the main 'plugin' command to be accessible by all users (level 1) while restricting the 'plugin.on' subcommand to administrators only (level 2).
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/command.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "plugin": 1, 
    "plugin.on": 2 
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Session-specific Rate Limits in pipeline.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of setting different rate limits for specific groups and users using the fixed window algorithm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/pipeline.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"fixwin": {
    "default": {
        "window-size": 60,
        "limit": 60
    },
    "group_12345678": {
        "window-size": 30,
        "limit": 60
    },
    "person_12341234": {
        "window-size": 60,
        "limit": 60
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Admin Sessions in system.json
DESCRIPTION: Defines admin sessions that have privileged access to the bot. Format is {type}_{id} where type is either "group" or "person".
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/system.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"admin-sessions": [],
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"admin-sessions": ["group_123456789", "person_123456789"],
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: å®ç°LangBotå†…å®¹å‡½æ•° - Python
DESCRIPTION: è¿™æ®µä»£ç å±•ç¤ºäº†å¦‚ä½•åœ¨LangBotæ’ä»¶ä¸­å®ç°ä¸€ä¸ªå†…å®¹å‡½æ•°ã€‚è¯¥å‡½æ•°å…è®¸è®¿é—®ç½‘é¡µå¹¶è¿”å›ç½‘é¡µå†…å®¹çš„æ‘˜è¦,å¯ä»¥è¢«å¤§è¯­è¨€æ¨¡å‹è°ƒç”¨æ¥è·å–åœ¨çº¿ä¿¡æ¯ã€‚
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/plugin/dev/tutor.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
# è¦æ·»åŠ çš„å‡½æ•°
@llm_func(name="access_the_web")  # è®¾ç½®å‡½æ•°åç§°
async def access_web(self, query, url: str):
    """Call this function to search about the question before you answer any questions.
    - Do not search through baidu.com at any time.
    - If you need to search somthing, visit https://www.google.com/search?q=xxx.
    - If user ask you to open a url (start with http:// or https://), visit it directly.
    - Summary the plain content result by yourself, DO NOT directly output anything in the result you got.

    Args:
        url(str): url to visit

    Returns:
        str: plain text content of the web page
    """
    import requests
    from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
    # ä½ éœ€è¦å…ˆä½¿ç”¨
    # pip install beautifulsoup4
    # å®‰è£…ä¾èµ–

    r = requests.get(
        url,
        timeout=10,
        headers={
            "User-Agent": "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/115.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/115.0.1901.183"
        }
    )
    soup = BeautifulSoup(r.text, 'html.parser')

    s = soup.get_text()

    # åˆ é™¤å¤šä½™çš„ç©ºè¡Œæˆ–ä»…æœ‰\tå’Œç©ºæ ¼çš„è¡Œ
    s = re.sub(r'\n\s*\n', '\n', s)

    if len(s) >= 512:  # æˆªå–è·å–åˆ°çš„ç½‘é¡µçº¯æ–‡æœ¬å†…å®¹çš„å‰512ä¸ªå­—
        return s[:512]

    return s
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: åˆå§‹åŒ–LangBotæ’ä»¶ - Python
DESCRIPTION: è¿™æ®µä»£ç å±•ç¤ºäº†ä¸€ä¸ªåŸºæœ¬çš„LangBotæ’ä»¶ç»“æ„,åŒ…æ‹¬æ’ä»¶æ³¨å†Œã€äº‹ä»¶å¤„ç†å’Œå†…å®¹å‡½æ•°ã€‚æ’ä»¶å®ç°äº†å¯¹'hello'æ¶ˆæ¯çš„å“åº”å’Œç½‘é¡µè®¿é—®åŠŸèƒ½ã€‚
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/plugin/dev/tutor.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
from pkg.plugin.context import register, handler, llm_func, BasePlugin, APIHost, EventContext
from pkg.plugin.events import *  # å¯¼å…¥äº‹ä»¶ç±»

"""
åœ¨æ”¶åˆ°ç§èŠæˆ–ç¾¤èŠæ¶ˆæ¯"hello"æ—¶ï¼Œå›å¤"hello, <å‘é€è€…id>!"æˆ–"hello, everyone!"
"""


# æ³¨å†Œæ’ä»¶
@register(name="Hello", description="hello world", version="0.1", author="RockChinQ")
class HelloPlugin(BasePlugin):

    # æ’ä»¶åŠ è½½æ—¶è§¦å‘
    def __init__(self, host: APIHost):
        pass

    # å¼‚æ­¥åˆå§‹åŒ–
    async def initialize(self):
        pass

    # å½“æ”¶åˆ°ä¸ªäººæ¶ˆæ¯æ—¶è§¦å‘
    @handler(PersonNormalMessageReceived)
    async def person_normal_message_received(self, ctx: EventContext):
        msg = ctx.event.text_message  # è¿™é‡Œçš„ event å³ä¸º PersonNormalMessageReceived çš„å¯¹è±¡
        if msg == "hello":  # å¦‚æœæ¶ˆæ¯ä¸ºhello

            # è¾“å‡ºè°ƒè¯•ä¿¡æ¯
            self.ap.logger.debug("hello, {}".format(ctx.event.sender_id))

            # å›å¤æ¶ˆæ¯ "hello, <å‘é€è€…id>!"
            ctx.add_return("reply", ["hello, {}!".format(ctx.event.sender_id)])

            # é˜»æ­¢è¯¥äº‹ä»¶é»˜è®¤è¡Œä¸ºï¼ˆå‘æ¥å£è·å–å›å¤ï¼‰
            ctx.prevent_default()

    # å½“æ”¶åˆ°ç¾¤æ¶ˆæ¯æ—¶è§¦å‘
    @handler(GroupNormalMessageReceived)
    async def group_normal_message_received(self, ctx: EventContext):
        msg = ctx.event.text_message  # è¿™é‡Œçš„ event å³ä¸º GroupNormalMessageReceived çš„å¯¹è±¡
        if msg == "hello":  # å¦‚æœæ¶ˆæ¯ä¸ºhello

            # è¾“å‡ºè°ƒè¯•ä¿¡æ¯
            self.ap.logger.debug("hello, {}".format(ctx.event.sender_id))

            # å›å¤æ¶ˆæ¯ "hello, everyone!"
            ctx.add_return("reply", ["hello, everyone!"])

            # é˜»æ­¢è¯¥äº‹ä»¶é»˜è®¤è¡Œä¸ºï¼ˆå‘æ¥å£è·å–å›å¤ï¼‰
            ctx.prevent_default()

    # æ’ä»¶å¸è½½æ—¶è§¦å‘
    def __del__(self):
        pass
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring OpenAI Base URL in provider.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the base URL for OpenAI API or compatible services in the provider.json file. It shows how to set the 'base-url' in the 'openai-chat-completions' section.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
        "openai-chat-completions": {
            "base-url": "https://api.example.com/v1",
            "args": {},
            "timeout": 120
        }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Admin Sessions in system.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up admin sessions in the system.json file. It shows how to add a user's QQ number to the 'admin-sessions' array to grant admin privileges.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
    "admin-sessions": [
        "person_1010553892"
    ]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Access Control in pipeline.json
DESCRIPTION: Controls which sessions' messages are processed using blacklist or whitelist mode. Messages are filtered based on session type and ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/pipeline.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"access-control":{
    "mode": "blacklist",
    "blacklist": [],
    "whitelist": []
},
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Message Ignore Rules in pipeline.json
DESCRIPTION: Defines patterns for ignoring specific incoming messages, with prefix matching and regular expression options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/pipeline.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"ignore-rules": {
    "prefix": ["/"],
    "regexp": []
},
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Rate Limiting Rules in pipeline.json
DESCRIPTION: Configures request rate limiting to prevent abuse, with options for handling strategy, algorithm, and specific limits per session.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/pipeline.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"rate-limit": {
    "strategy": "drop",
    "algo": "fixwin",
    "fixwin": {
        "default": {
            "window-size": 60,
            "limit": 60
        }
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Session Concurrency in system.json
DESCRIPTION: Controls how many concurrent message processing tasks are allowed per session, with a default fallback for unspecified sessions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/system.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"session-concurrency": {
    "default": 1
},
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Plugin Management Commands Reference
DESCRIPTION: Lists all available commands for managing plugins in LangBot, including installation, updates, enabling/disabling, and listing functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/plugin/plugin-intro.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
!plugin                    åˆ—å‡ºæ‰€æœ‰å·²å®‰è£…çš„æ’ä»¶
!plugin get <å‚¨å­˜åº“åœ°å€>    ä»GitHubå‚¨å­˜åº“åœ°å€å®‰è£…æ’ä»¶(éœ€è¦ç®¡ç†å‘˜æƒé™)
!plugin update all         æ›´æ–°æ‰€æœ‰æ’ä»¶(éœ€è¦ç®¡ç†å‘˜æƒé™ï¼Œä»…æ”¯æŒä»å‚¨å­˜åº“å®‰è£…çš„æ’ä»¶)
!plugin update <æ’ä»¶å>    æ›´æ–°æŒ‡å®šæ’ä»¶
!plugin del <æ’ä»¶å>       åˆ é™¤æ’ä»¶(éœ€è¦ç®¡ç†å‘˜æƒé™)
!plugin on <æ’ä»¶å>        å¯ç”¨æ’ä»¶(éœ€è¦ç®¡ç†å‘˜æƒé™)
!plugin off <æ’ä»¶å>       ç¦ç”¨æ’ä»¶(éœ€è¦ç®¡ç†å‘˜æƒé™)

!func                      åˆ—å‡ºæ‰€æœ‰å†…å®¹å‡½æ•°
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Discord Adapter in platform.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the Discord adapter. It includes settings for client ID and token.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "adapter": "discord",
    "enable": false,
    "client_id": "1234567890",
    "token": "XXXXXXXXXX"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Pipeline Concurrency in system.json
DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum concurrent pipeline message processing tasks for the entire program using FCFS scheduling algorithm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/system.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"pipeline-concurrency": 20,
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring QQOfficial Adapter in LangBot
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows the configuration structure for the QQOfficial adapter in LangBot. It includes fields for the adapter type, enable flag, AppID, secret, port, and token.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/platforms/qq/official_webhook.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "adapter": "qqofficial",
    "enable": true,
    "appid": "",
    "secret": "",
    "port": 2284,
    "token": ""
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Group-specific Response Rules in pipeline.json
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create different response rules for specific group chats by their ID, overriding the default rules.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/pipeline.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"respond-rules": {
    "default": {
        "at": true,
        "prefix": [
            "/ai", "!ai", "ï¼ai", "ai"
        ],
        "regexp": [],
        "random": 0.0
    },
    "123456":{
        "at": true,
        "prefix": [
            "/ai", "!ai", "ï¼ai", "ai"
        ],
        "regexp": [],
        "random": 0.0
    },
    "789012":{
        "at": true,
        "prefix": [
            "/ai", "!ai", "ï¼ai", "ai"
        ],
        "regexp": [],
        "random": 0.0
    }
},
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring WeChat Work Customer Service Adapter in platform.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the WeChat Work Customer Service (ä¼ä¸šå¾®ä¿¡å®¢æœå·) adapter. It includes settings for port, corp ID, secret, token, and encoding AES key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
        "adapter": "wecomcs",
        "enable": false,
        "port": 2289,
        "corpid": "",
        "secret": "",
        "token": "",
        "EncodingAESKey": ""
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring qq-botpy Adapter in platform.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the qq-botpy adapter to connect with QQ official bot API using websocket. It includes settings for app ID, secret, and intents for different message types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "adapter": "qq-botpy",
    "enable": false,
    "appid": "",
    "secret": "",
    "intents": [
        "public_guild_messages",
        "direct_message",
        "public_messages"
    ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Slack Adapter in platform.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the Slack adapter. It includes settings for bot token, signing secret, and port.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "adapter":"slack",
    "enable":false,
    "bot_token":"",
    "signing_secret":"",
    "port":2288
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring WeChat Official Account Adapter in platform.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the WeChat Official Account adapter. It includes settings for token, encoding key, app secret, app ID, mode, loading message, host, and port.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "adapter":"officialaccount",
    "enable": true,
    "token": "",
    "EncodingAESKey":"",
    "AppSecret":"",
    "AppID":"",
    "Mode":"drop",
    "LoadingMessage":"AIæ­£åœ¨æ€è€ƒä¸­ï¼Œè¯·å‘é€ä»»æ„å†…å®¹è·å–å›å¤ã€‚",
    "host": "0.0.0.0",
    "port": 2287
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Plugin via Repository Cloning Command
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the command syntax for installing a plugin by cloning its GitHub repository, which is the recommended installation method for LangBot plugins.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/plugin/plugin-intro.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
!plugin get https://github.com/langbot-app/HelloPlugin
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Persistence in system.json
DESCRIPTION: Defines database settings for data persistence. Currently only supports SQLite with a configurable database file path.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/system.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"persistence": {
    "sqlite": {
        "path": "data/persistence.db"
    },
    "use": "sqlite"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Group Message Response Rules in pipeline.json
DESCRIPTION: Defines the rules for when the bot should respond to messages in group chats. Rules can include responding to mentions, message prefixes, regexp patterns, or random probability.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/pipeline.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"respond-rules": {
    "default": {
        "at": true,
        "prefix": [
            "/ai", "!ai", "ï¼ai", "ai"
        ],
        "regexp": [],
        "random": 0.0
    }
},
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Baidu Cloud Content Moderation in pipeline.json
DESCRIPTION: Settings for integrating with Baidu Cloud's content moderation service, including API credentials.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/pipeline.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"baidu-cloud-examine": {
    "enable": false,
    "api-key": "",
    "api-secret": ""
},
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Sensitive Word Checking in pipeline.json
DESCRIPTION: Controls whether to check messages against a sensitive word list defined in sensitive-words.json.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/pipeline.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"check-sensitive-words": true,
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example Plugin Configuration in plugins.json
DESCRIPTION: Shows the structure of the plugins.json configuration file which is automatically generated and used by LangBot to manage plugin settings, including priority and enabled status.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/plugin/plugin-intro.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"plugins": [
    {
        "name": "Nahida",
        "description": "Hello Nahida",
        "version": "0.1",
        "author": "RockChinQ",
        "source": "",   
        "main_file": "plugins/Nahida/main.py",
        "pkg_path": "plugins/Nahida/",
        "priority": 0,  
        "enabled": true   
    }
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring qqofficial Adapter in platform.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the qqofficial adapter to connect with QQ official bot using webhook. It includes settings for app ID, secret, token, and port.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "adapter": "qqofficial",
    "enable": false,
    "appid": "",
    "secret": "",
    "port": 2284,
    "token": ""
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring HTTP API in system.json
DESCRIPTION: Controls the HTTP service settings required for WebUI access, including host, port and JWT token expiration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/system.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"http-api": {
    "enable": true,
    "host": "0.0.0.0",
    "port": 5300,
    "jwt-expire": 604800
},
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Nakuru Adapter in platform.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the Nakuru adapter to connect with go-cqhttp. It includes settings for host, WebSocket port, HTTP port, and token.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "adapter": "nakuru",
    "enable": false,
    "host": "127.0.0.1",
    "ws_port": 8080,
    "http_port": 5700,
    "token": ""
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring WeChat Work Adapter in platform.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the WeChat Work (ä¼ä¸šå¾®ä¿¡) adapter. It includes settings for host, port, and various authentication keys required for WeChat Work integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:

```
    "adapter": "wecom",
    "enable": false,
    "host": "0.0.0.0",
    "port": 2290,
    "corpid": "",
    "secret": "",
    "token": "",
    "EncodingAESKey": "",

}
```

TITLE: Configuring DingTalk Adapter in platform.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the DingTalk (é’‰é’‰) adapter. It includes settings for client ID, client secret, robot code, robot name, and markdown card option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

```
    "adapter":"dingtalk",

    "client_id":"",

}
```

TITLE: Setting Command Prefixes in LangBot
DESCRIPTION: Defines the command prefixes that LangBot will recognize. Messages starting with any of these prefixes will be treated as commands (subject to group response rules). This example configures three different command prefixes including both Latin and full-width punctuation marks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/command.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"command-prefix": [
    "!",
    "ï¼",
    "#"
]
```

TITLE: Configuring Feishu Adapter in platform.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up the Feishu (é£ä¹¦) adapter. It includes settings for app ID, app secret, bot name, webhook enablement, port, and encrypt key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/quick-config/config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

CODE:

```
    "adapter": "lark",
    "enable": false,
    "app_id": "cli_abcdefgh",
    "app_secret": "XXXXXXXXXX",

    "enable-webhook": false,
    "port": 2285,
    "encrypt-key": "xxxxxxxxx"
}
```

```
    "gewechat_url": "http://gewe:2531",

}
```

```
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Network Proxies in system.json
DESCRIPTION: Sets up HTTP and HTTPS proxies for network connectivity. These settings override environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/system.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"network-proxies": {
    "http": null,
    "https": null
},
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"network-proxies": {
    "http": "http://127.0.0.1:7890",
    "https": "http://127.0.0.1:7890"
},
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Multiple Platform Adapters Example
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure multiple platform adapters simultaneously, with one disabled (aiocqhttp) and one enabled (nakuru) with different ports and settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/platform.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"platform-adapters": [
    {
        "adapter": "aiocqhttp",
        "enable": false,
        "host": "0.0.0.0",
        "port": 2280,
        "access-token": "",
    },
    {
        "adapter": "nakuru",
        "enable": true,
        "host": "127.0.0.1",
        "ws_port": 8081,
        "http_port": 5701,
        "token": "token"
    }
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting at-sender Option
DESCRIPTION: Option to configure whether to mention (@ tag) the original sender when replying in group chats. When set to true, replies will mention the user who sent the original message.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/platform.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"at-sender": false,
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting track-function-calls Option
DESCRIPTION: Configuration to track content function calls. When enabled, the system sends function call records to users during conversations. When disabled, only final results are sent.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/platform.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"track-function-calls": true,
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting quote-origin Option
DESCRIPTION: Option to configure whether to quote the original message when replying in group chats. When set to true, replies will include a reference to the original message.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/platform.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"quote-origin": false,
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting hide-exception-info Option
DESCRIPTION: Configuration to hide AI exception details from users. When enabled, users will see a generic error message while detailed error information is only logged to the console.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/platform.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"hide-exception-info": true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring long-text-process Strategy
DESCRIPTION: Settings for handling long text messages. Includes threshold for when to apply strategy, the strategy type (forward or image), and font path for rendering text as images.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/platform.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"long-text-process": {
    "threshold": 256,
    "strategy": "forward",
    "font-path": ""
},
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Usage Reporting in system.json
DESCRIPTION: Controls whether telemetry data is reported to developers for analysis. Does not include sensitive information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/system.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"report-usage": true,
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Help Message in system.json
DESCRIPTION: Sets the response text when users send the !help command, typically containing information about the bot and useful links.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/system.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"help-message": "LangBot - ğŸ˜é«˜ç¨³å®šæ€§ã€ğŸ§©æ”¯æŒæ’ä»¶ã€ğŸ¦„å¤šæ¨¡æ€çš„ ChatGPT QQ æœºå™¨äººğŸ¤–\né“¾æ¥ï¼šhttps://langbot.app"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Conversation History Truncation in pipeline.json
DESCRIPTION: Controls how conversation history is truncated before being sent to the model, limiting by number of dialogue rounds.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/pipeline.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"msg-truncate": {
    "method": "round",
    "round": {
        "max-round": 10
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Logging Level in system.json
DESCRIPTION: Sets the logging verbosity level, although currently only controllable through DEBUG environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/system.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"logging-level": "info",
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Caddyfile for Reverse Proxy
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure the Caddyfile for reverse proxying HTTP requests to HTTPS. It shows the basic structure and an example with a specific domain.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/deploy/platforms/qq/official_webhook.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
your_domain_name {
        reverse_proxy 127.0.0.1:2284
}
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
testlb.com {
        reverse_proxy 127.0.0.1:2284
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring force-delay Range
DESCRIPTION: Sets a forced delay range in seconds before sending messages back to users. This helps prevent platform rate limiting. The array contains minimum and maximum delay values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/config/function/platform.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"force-delay": [0, 0],
```

CODE:

```
        },
        "members": {
            "547A6244A731B4BEEBE5EE2AE4CD00A8": 232437565267568
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Deploying NewAPI Middleware
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set up the NewAPI middleware, which translates between Dify's API and OpenAI-compatible APIs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/workshop/dify-integration.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
apt install -y wget
mkdir ~/new-api
cd new-api
# For arm64:
wget https://github.com/Calcium-Ion/new-api/releases/download/v0.2.9.7/one-api-arm64
# For x86/64:
wget https://github.com/Calcium-Ion/new-api/releases/download/v0.2.9.7/one-api
apt install -y screen
chmod 775 new-api
./new-api
```

TITLE: Displaying Table of Contents in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: ä½¿ç”¨Markdownè¯­æ³•æ˜¾ç¤ºæ–‡æ¡£ç›®å½•ã€‚è¿™æ®µä»£ç ä½¿ç”¨äº†ç‰¹å®šçš„è¯­æ³•æ¥ç”Ÿæˆä¸€ä¸ªè‡ªåŠ¨çš„ç›®å½•ç»“æ„ã€‚
SOURCE: https://github.com/the-lazy-me/langbot-wiki/blob/main/docs/tob/platform.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
:::info ç›®å½•
[[toc]]
:::
```
